children.data: In addition to those quoted in the report, the author would like to thank the following people for their assistance:

Benjamin Bellegy, Manisha Bharti, Genny Biggs, Josh Birkholz, Jen Carter, Cathy Cha, Tyler Cowen, Asha Curran, Anamitra Deb, Joel Fleishman, Bill Gates, Don Gips, Brigitte Hoyer Gosselink, Crystal Hayling, Heather Higginbottom, Renee Kaplan, Karen Kardos, Carol Lake, Ray Madoff, Stacy Palmer, Amir Pasic, Steve Quake, Nadia Roumani, Chavi Sharma, Smarinita Shetty, Jon Skolnick, Benjamin Soskis, Mark Suzman, Nicholas Tedesco, Amy Thompson, Elbert Ventura

parts.headline: Move fast and mend things
parts.description: The super-rich are hoping to get money to the needy faster, says Avantika Chilkoti

parts.description: They are hoping to get money to the needy faster, says Avantika Chilkoti

parts.headline: No-strings philanthropy is giving charities more decision-making power
parts.description: Organisations on the ground know best how money should be spent

parts.description: Donors want a quicker, easier way to give

parts.headline: The “effective altruism” movement is louder than it is large

parts.headline: The future of philanthropy will involve a mix of different approaches
parts.description: The main issue is persuading the rich to give at all
